channel.title: Female Command: A few Errors
channel.description:
Hello, I successfully added the ::female command and ::male command, But if your a male character and do ::female, you have to click on a piece of clothing to actually turn into a female. SAME WITH MALE.
How can I make it so it automatically turns you into a female/male instantly when that command is entered?
Thanks!

item.title: Female Command: A few Errors
item.dc:creator: @Mario_PvP Mario PvP
item.description:
@Mario_PvP wrote:

the female shirt thing is probally normal?
like dragonhide body’s you also see the sleves.

Read full topic

item.title: Female Command: A few Errors
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

Go to the equip or equipment class and put the Infinity top’s item ID in there. I don’t want to explain it it’s to easy. But if you open the class(s) I stated you should be fine, along with you having common Java knowledge.

Read full topic

item.title: Female Command: A few Errors
item.dc:creator: @Danny_Roggia Danny Roggia
item.description:
@Danny_Roggia wrote:

I’ve followed this guide: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,540811.0.html
(667-700 tut list)

Please note: It doesn’t work at all for normal players.

[code]}

public void female() {
	look[0] = 46; // Hair
	look[1] = 57; // Beard
	look[2] = 57; // Torso
	look[3] = 65; // Arms
	look[4] = 68; // Bracelets
	look[5] = 77; // Legs
	look[6] = 80; // Shoes

	colour[2] = 16;
	colour[1] = 16;
	colour[0] = 3;
	male = false;
}[/code]

[code]}

	                        if (cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase("female")) {                
                                                    player.getAppearence().female();  
                                                    return true;
                                    }
                                                                    
                                    if (cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase("male")) {        
                                                    player.getAppearence().male();     
                                                    return true;
                                    }[/code]

Top=Appearance.java
bottom=commands.java

Please tell me if i’m doing something wrong?

  • When shirts are worn by females their default shirt shows over the armor…why? +

On males it does NOT show, which I want for females…

Read full topic

You have to make the command also send the update for the players appearance
